data.title: Prince Henry of Battenberg (1858
data.meta_description: Carl Rudolph was the son of Carl Ferdinand Sohn (1805-1867); the father was known to Queen Victoria through his portrait of the Queen of Hanover (RCIN 405078); the son was employed by members of the Royal Family 1882-6. Prince Henry (1858-96) was the husband of Queen Victorias youngest daughter Beatrice and known as Liko in the family. Two days before Princess Beatrice married Prince Henry, Queen Victoria gave her Sohns picture of Liko â€¦which is an excellent likeness. To Liko I gave the pendant of...
